skills.label: Understand computer storage and data types
items: How a computer stores programs and the instructions in computer memory, memory stacks and heaps, memory size requirements for the various data storage types, numeric data and textual data

skills.label: Understand computer decision structures
items: Various decision structures used in all computer programming languages
If decision structures
Multiple decision structures, such as ifâ€¦else and switch/select case
Reading flowcharts
Decision tables
Evaluating expressions

skills.label: Identify the appropriate method for handling repetition
items: For loops, while loops, do...while loops, and recursion

skills.label: Understand error handling
items: Structured exception handling

skills.label: Understand the fundamentals of classes
items: Properties, methods, events, and constructors
How to create a class
How to use classes in code

skills.label: Understand inheritance
items: Inheriting the functionality of a base class into a derived class

skills.label: Understand polymorphism
items: Extending the functionality in a class after inheriting from a base class, overriding methods in the derived class

skills.label: Understand encapsulation
items: Creating classes that hide their implementation details while still allowing access to the required functionality through the interface, access modifiers

skills.label: Understand application life cycle management
items: Phases of application life cycle management, software testing

skills.label: Interpret application specifications
items: Reading application specifications and translating them into prototypes, code, select appropriate application type, and components

skills.label: Understand algorithms and data structures
items: Arrays, stacks, queues, linked lists, and sorting algorithms
Performance implications of various data structures
Choosing the right data structure

skills.label: Understand web page development
items: Html, cascading style sheets (css), javascript

skills.label: Understand Microsoft ASP.NET web application development
items: Page life cycle, event model, state management, client-side versus server-side programming

skills.label: Understand web hosting
items: Creating virtual directories and websites, deploying web applications, understanding the role of internet information services

skills.label: Understand web services
items: Web services that will be consumed by client applications, accessing web services from a client application, soap and web service definition language (wsdl)

skills.label: Understand Windows apps
items: Ui design guideline categories, characteristics and capabilities of store apps, identify gestures

skills.label: Understand console-based applications
items: Characteristics and capabilities of console-based applications

skills.label: Understand Windows Services
items: Characteristics and capabilities of windows services

skills.label: Understand relational database management systems
items: Characteristics and capabilities of database products, database design, entity relationship diagrams (erds), normalization concepts

skills.label: Understand database query methods
items: Structured query language (sql), creating and accessing stored procedures, updating data and selecting data

skills.label: Understand database connection methods
items: Connecting to various types of data stores, such as flat file
Xml file
In-memory object
Resource optimization
